Pit Grit.name: Pit Grit
Pit Grit.description: Innate - Heavy Hands: Sett's basic attacks alternate between a left punch then a right punch. Sett begins attacking with a left punch, and will reset back to it after 2 seconds of not performing a right punch.
Pit Grit.description2: Sett's right punch gains  50 bonus range, attacks at 8 times the left punch's attack speed, and deals 5 − 90 (based on level) (+  15% AD)  bonus physical damage.
Pit Grit.description3: Innate - Heart of the Half-Beast: Sett gains  0.25 / 0.5 / 1 / 2 (based on level) health regeneration per second for every 5% of his missing  health.
Pit Grit.notes:
* The right punch does not grant  bonus attack speed, rather is fixed at 800% of the left punch  total attack speed and it is unaffected by  cripples and attack speed buffs (i.e  Hail of Blades) for the duration.
 Heavy Hands punch cadence and right punch are an on-attack effect and do not interact with Guinsoo's Rageblade passive.

Knuckle Down.name: Knuckle Down
Knuckle Down.description: Active: For the first 1.5 seconds, Sett gains  30% bonus movement speed while moving towards an enemy  champion.
Knuckle Down.description2: Sett's next two basic attacks within 5 seconds each deal bonus physical damage. Consuming an attack will refresh the timer.
Knuckle Down.leveling2:
Bonus Physical Damage:
10 / 20 / 30 / 40 / 50 (+ 1 / 2 / 3 / 4 / 5% (+ 1% per 100 AD) of target's maximum health)
Total Bonus Damage:
20 / 40 / 60 / 80 / 100 (+ 2 / 4 / 6 / 8 / 10% (+ 2% per 100 AD) of target's maximum health)
Knuckle Down.description3: Knuckle Down resets Sett's basic attack timer and  Pit Grit's punch cadence. The second attack will be a right punch.

Haymaker.name: Haymaker
Haymaker.description: Passive: Sett stores 100% of post-mitigation damage taken as Grit on his secondary resource bar, up to 50% of his  maximum health. Each instance of stored Grit decays by 30% every second after 4 seconds.
Haymaker.description2: Active: Sett blasts an area in the target direction, dealing  physical damage to enemies hit. Enemies hit through the center take  true damage instead.
Haymaker.leveling2:
Physical / True Damage:
90 / 125 / 160 / 195 / 230 (+ 25% (+ 10% per 100 bonus AD) of expended Grit)
Haymaker.description3: Down but not out: Sett also gains a rapidly decaying  shield for 3 seconds equal to the Grit expended.
Haymaker.notes:
* The shield is created immediately and will decay after the blast delay.
 Sett will glow when attaining 90% Grit.

Facebreaker.name: Facebreaker
Facebreaker.description: Active: Sett  pulls in enemies at his front and back, dealing physical damage and  slowing them by 50% for 0.5 seconds.
Facebreaker.description2: If Facebreaker affects at least one enemy on each side, all enemies are  stunned for 1 second upon landing.
Facebreaker.notes:
* Sett will attempt to basic attack the closest target.
 A target will rebound to Sett's attack range.
 There is a smaller affected area at Sett's sides, the indicator does not illustrate this for practical reasons.

The Show Stopper.name: The Show Stopper
The Show Stopper.description: Active: Sett  suppresses the target enemy  champion and then  dashes  unstoppably at a fixed distance toward them,  carrying the target for 1.5 seconds before slamming them into the ground.
The Show Stopper.description2: Enemies within the impact area take physical damage, reduced by up to 40% at the edge, and are  slowed by 99% for 1.5 seconds.
The Show Stopper.leveling2:
Physical Damage:
200 / 250 / 300 / 350 / 400 (+ 100% bonus AD) (+ 40 / 45 / 50 / 55 / 60% of primary target's bonus health)
Minimum Physical Damage:
120 / 150 / 180 / 210 / 240 (+ 60% bonus AD) (+ 24 / 27 / 30 / 33 / 36% of primary target's bonus health)
The Show Stopper.description3: The dash will prematurely end upon reaching a wall that cannot be dashed through.
The Show Stopper.notes:
* Sett lands 200 units farther from the impact, the damage is applied after the time it takes to reposition.
  Spell shields,  untargetability,  unstoppability as well as  cleansing the suppression prevent Sett from carrying his target but will not interrupt The Show Stopper.
 Getting forced to perform an action (i.e  Charm,  Fear,  Taunt) will prevent The Show Stopper from dealing damage.
